outrage.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a feeling of great anger and shock
outrage.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The response to the jury’s verdict was one of outrage.
environmentalists’ outrage at plans to develop the coastline
outrage.translation[0].definitions[1].de: an event that produces great anger and shock, especially because it is cruel or violent
outrage.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to make someone feel very angry and shocked
outrage.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Customers were outraged by the price increases.
